comment.author: 23085117@N00
comment._content: I've been keeping an eye out wondering if the Library has a photograph of my ancestor Charles Brindley, master of the Ward Union Hunt. If NLI has photos of any of my ancestors, I'm betting he's the most likely one you'd have.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/spidra] Wow! Just did a bit of Googling, and he was very well-known, including this monument: www.ashbournehistoricalsociety.com/archives/papref_brindl... Will certainly keep an eye out myself... We also have this book: catalogue.nli.ie/Record/vtls000142591 presumably Jim Brindley is also a relative?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23085117@N00
comment._content:
I've seen the monument (in photos, not in person. I've only been to Ireland once and couldn't do it all in one go). Jim was Charles' son and succeeded him as Master of the Hunt of the Ward Union. So a great-great-granduncle of mine. I found out about the book after my trip and saw that you had a copy. If only I'd known before my trip!

Most of the rest of my Irish relatives were farmers from Munster so I doubt there are many photos or mentions of them.

comment.author: 55597723@N02
comment._content: Looks like the two Gentlemen took good care of those Dogs. Nice photo.
